abstract.p: Kings Supermarkets plans to open new store on Franklin Avenue in Garden City, its first on Long Island (S)

block.p: Kings Super Markets Opening First L.I. Store
Kings Super Markets plans to open a new store at 870 Franklin Avenue in Garden City at 9 a.m. today.
This is the first store on Long Island for the Kings chain, based in Parsippany, N.J. The company has 25 stores and 2,500 employees in northern New Jersey.

Pall Completes Loans For a Total of $300 Million
The Pall Corporation (NYSE: PLL) of East Hills says that it has completed two loans for a total of $300 million.

The first, arranged by Wachovia Securities Inc., is $100 million in fixed-rate unsecured notes due in 2010. The second, arranged by Fleet Bank, is for $200 million in a revolving line of credit due in 2005.
With annual sales of over $1 billion, Pall Corporation is one of the world's largest filtration, separations and purification companies.
Long Island Financial Repurchases Its Stock

Douglas C. Manditch, the president and chief executive of the Long Island Financial Corporation (Nasdaq: LICB) of Islandia, the holding company for Long Island Commercial Bank, has announced that the company has repurchased 177,500 shares -- 10 percent -- of its common stock at an average price of $11.49 per share.

The company also announced plans to repurchase an additional 10 percent of its common stock, about 160,000 shares, on the open market. The company intends to hold the repurchased shares in its treasury for general corporate use.
Long Island Commercial Bank has six offices, in Islandia, Babylon Jericho, Shirley, Smithtown and Westbury.
The Computer Concepts Corporation of Bohemia has changed its name to the Direct Insite Corporation and now trades on Nasdaq under the symbol DIRI.
The company markets software and services directly to Fortune 500 companies.
